text:
It would be nice if there was a Ant property for specifying the location of the
gcj binary when using the "gcj" compiler adapter. Currently it defaults to
"gcj", assuming that a binary named "gcj" is on the current path. This makes it
hard to override with a specific version of gcj as in /usr/bin/gcj-4.0.
creator: wasabi@larvalstage.net
mbenson@apache.org
text:
Doc for javac's executable attribute says:

Complete path to the javac  executable to use in case of fork="yes". Defaults to
the compiler of the Java version that is currently running Ant. Ignored if
fork="no".
Since Ant 1.6 this attribute can also be used to specify the path to the
executable when using jikes, jvc, gcj or sj.
